intro: Uragoga ankafinensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, red berries. Uragoga ankafinensis is often found in humid, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
